item.title: The Blue Afternoon That Lasted Forever
item.description: Daniel H. Wilson A story I loved so much I had to transcribe it from William Flew’s Archive Science fiction is so intriguing because it can examine the cosmic and the infinitesimal, the future and the past, the human and the immesurable. Daniel H. Wilson’s story does all that, in less than four thousand words. “It’s late at night, my darling. And the stars are in the sky.
